comment.author: 24231207@N07
comment._content:
SULZER APPOINTS PRISON INVESTIGATOR; George W. Blake, Newspaper Writer, to Inquire Into Department Affairs.

Special to The New York Times.

March 15, 1913, Saturday

ALBANY, N.Y., March 14. -- Gov. Sulzer to-day appointed George W. Blake, a New York newspaper writer, Special Commissioner to investigate the management and affairs of all the prisons and reformatories in the State. The Governor yesterday removed Col. Joseph F. Scott from the office of Superintendent of Prisons and nominated Judge John B. Riley of Plattsburg for the place.
